configuration.note: All activation evaluations use Neuronpedia API. Activation threshold is dynamically calculated from top 10 high-activating API exemplars (average of max activations / 2). Generation Evaluation uses top 10 high-activating exemplars. Prediction Evaluation uses selected exemplars directly from API (excluding top 10), with activation values already available (no API calls needed for activations). model_name and sae_path are kept for record-keeping only and are not used for any calculations.

explanation.description: Feature 72252 primarily detects the exact mid-sentence token " build" (leading space), with strict token-boundary/case sensitivity. Across tests it consistently peaks on ' build' with activation 0.7500–2.3906, while synonyms ("construct", "develop") and boundary/case/compound variants yield 0.0000. The gerund " building" usually does not activate (0.1230 or 0.0000) except in the specific prepositional frame "for building [NP]", which shows moderate activation (1.2734–1.6953).
explanation.evidence:
- Test 1: 'We need to build a robust API.' → ' build'=1.9062 (supports H1)
- Test 4: 'Our team plans to build a prototype today.' → ' build'=0.7500 (supports H1)
- Test 10: 'They help build value.' → ' build'=1.9062 (supports H1)
- Test 14: 'In order to build a request.' → ' build'=2.3906 (supports H1)
- Test 11: 'We plan to construct software.' → 0.0000 (supports H1 specificity)
- Test 15: 'We plan to develop software.' → 0.0000 (supports H1 specificity)
- Test 2: 'We are building a detector.' → ' building'=0.1230 (refutes H2 general claim)
- Test 12: 'This is for building capacity.' → ' building'=1.6953 (refines H2: PP frame effect)
- Test 13: 'We aim for building partnerships.' → ' building'=1.2734 (refines H2: PP frame effect)
- Test 16: 'This is for building trust.' → ' building'=1.6953 (refines H2: PP frame effect)
- Test 17: 'The building is old.' → ' building'=0.0000 (noun sense; refutes H2 general claim)
- Test 5: 'He built a house.' → ' built'=0.0000 (refutes H2)
- Test 6: 'She builds prototypes.' → ' builds'=0.0000 (refutes H2)
- Test 7: 'They hired a builder.' → ' builder'=0.0000 (refutes H2)
- Test 3: 'Build a house.' → 'Build'=0.0000 (supports H3 boundary/case sensitivity)
- Test 18: 'We will Build together.' → ' Build'=0.0000 (supports H3 boundary/case sensitivity)
- Test 8: 'We must rebuild quickly.' → ' rebuild'=0.0000 (supports H3 compounding/prefix insensitivity)
- Test 9: 'It was a build-up.' → ' build'=0.0000; '-up'=0.0000 (supports H3 hyphenated compound insensitivity)
- Test 19: 'It needs a build-out.' → ' build'=0.0000; '-out'=0.0000 (supports H3 hyphenated compound insensitivity)

labels.text: Mid-sentence lexical " build" detector (leading-space; boundary/case/compound sensitive)
Prepositional gerund frame "for building [NP]" (moderate activation; other "building" uses near-zero)

explanation.label1: Mid-sentence lexical " build" detector (leading-space; boundary/case/compound sensitive)
explanation.label2: Prepositional gerund frame "for building [NP]" (moderate activation; other "building" uses near-zero)

prediction_evaluation.note: Prediction Evaluation uses selected exemplars directly from API (excluding top 10 used for Generation Evaluation). Exemplars are categorized into high, medium, and low activation groups from remaining exemplars, and randomly selected from each group. Activation values are already available from exemplars, so no API calls are needed to get activations. This avoids bias from explanation text and ensures diverse activation levels in evaluation examples.
